content:
I'm sure this has been mentioned before somewhere, but I can't find it. When one first gets leanblueprint up and running, the blueprint obtained doesn't look like much the ones linked to in the Readme. In particular, one doesn't get the sidebar enumerating sections. Only after digging for a while did I find out that my install might be correct (I thought for sure there had to be some error because my blueprint didn't look like the ones linked to). How does one go about changing the style to match the blueprints in the links more closely? Would it be good to have the style include a sidebar as default?

I guess I should ping @Patrick Massot with this. Thanks, in advance, for any help!
I am surprised by that problem. Is your blueprint public? It would be a lot easier to diagnose.
Do you actually have chapters or sections in your blueprint? I vaguely remember that the left menu appears only if there is something to show there. I might misremember though.
Indeed, that would be a very good explanation. But I guess Jon wouldn’t ask for an empty side-bar.
Sorry for the delay, all. I've of course broken things in the attempt to fix them so waiting for a build. I do have sections and chapters, but no sidebar.

This is the site currently: https://jonbannon.github.io/double_commutant/

I'm waiting for a build where I've stolen a richer set of things from Loreaux's working example...
You don't seem to have any \chapter{}s in your TeX file at https://github.com/JonBannon/double_commutant/blob/master/blueprint/src/content.tex

https://github.com/JonBannon/double_commutant/blob/master/blueprint/src/plastex.cfg#L12 tells plastex you want new files for every chapter, as explained at https://plastex.github.io/plastex/plastex/sec-config-files.html (search for the split-level option).
So you can either change split-level to 1 if you want one page per section or create chapters.
Thanks, @Patrick Massot and @Mauricio Collares . I had sections, but no chapters... thanks particularly for the precise pointer into the documentation for plastex, Patrick.
